headline: JPMorgan expands tech team with Guggenheim veteran, memo says
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -JPMorgan Chase is hiring Guggenheim Securities executive Mike Amez, as the country's biggest bank continues to expand its technology investment banking team and to provide specific expertise to medium-sized companies, according to a staff memo.  Amez will join as Head of Mid-Cap Technology Services in September and be based in Chicago, Global Co-Heads of Technology Investment Banking Chris Grose and Greg Mendelson wrote in the memo which was seen by Reuters.  At Guggenheim, Amez was a senior managing director in the technology investment banking group, specializing in supporting IT services, cybersecurity services and hyperscale cloud infrastructure clients.

headline: BILL's Fee-Based Revenues Surge: Can Higher TPV Drive More Upside?
summary: BILL's fee-based revenues increase 17% due to higher TPV. However, softer customer spending and tough fintech rivals weigh on the growth outlook.

headline: Merchant Industry Supercharges Growth with Jamie Garfield as Strategic Advisor
summary: LONG ISLAND CITY, N.Y., July 08, 2025--Merchant Industry, a nationwide leader in payment technology and merchant services, is proud to announce the appointment of Jamie Garfield as Strategic Advisor, bringing with her an extraordinary 28-year track record of success in the acquiring and payments space. Jamie’s appointment marks a bold step forward as the company positions itself for accelerated innovation, channel growth, and long-term success.

Jamie’s appointment marks a bold step forward as the company positions itself for accelerated innovation, channel growth, and long-term success.
